formula: For a general k >= 1, c_n(k) = phi(n)*mu(n/gcd(n, k)) / phi(n/gcd(n, k)); so c_n(1) = mu(n) = A008683(n).
Dirichlet g.f.: (1+2^(1-s))/zeta(s). [Titchmarsh eq. (1.5.4)] - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 26 2011
example: a(4) = -2 because the primitive fourth roots of unity are i and -i.  We sum their squares to get i^2 + (-i)^2 = -1 + -1 = -2. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Dec 30 2015
mathematica: f[list_, i_] := list[[i]]; nn = 105; a = Table[MoebiusMu[n], {n, 1, nn}]; b =Table[If[IntegerQ[2/n], n, 0], {n, 1,nn}];Table[DirichletConvolve[f[a, n], f[b, n], n, m], {m, 1, nn}] (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Dec 30 2015 *)
